III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Description • (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and
suitable and able to meet the needs of children and families
served by the agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On multiple occasions, a staff member has arrived for shift while
under the influence of alcohol. During their last shift, the staff
member left the premises with a youth to visit a nearby liquor store
where they purchased additional alcohol and items for the youth
such as vape products.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Foster Care Worker was interviewed by phone while MDHHS
Worker was with her in person on 6/4/2025 and in-person at the
independent living home along with MDHHS Worker and
Detective on 6/6/2025. Foster Care Worker reported Staff 1 has
no prior write-ups; however, another staff member caught Staff 1
sleeping at work, so she received verbal coaching. Foster Care
Worker stated she sent an email coaching to Staff 1 this week for
not completing her walkthrough of the home and bedrooms during
her shift. Foster Care Worker stated there are cameras in the
home, but they are pointing toward the front door.
Youth A was interviewed by phone while MDHHS Worker was
with her in-person on 6/4/2025 and in-person at the independent
living home along with MDHHS Worker and Detective on
6/6/2025. During her first interview, Youth A reported that, last
Sunday, 6/1/25, Staff 1 came into work drunk. She stated she
knows this because Staff 1 walked with Youth A to the gas station
and during the walk, Staff 1 said “I’m so drunk right now.” Youth A
stated Staff 1 was stumbling a bit at the time. Youth A stated Staff
1 bought some snacks, a soda, and a vape. Youth A reported
Staff 1 did not give the vape to Youth A. Youth A stated she
doesn’t think Staff 1 has ever bought anything for anyone;
however, Youth A then stated she saw Staff 1 buy Youth D a blue
raspberry flavored vape a few weeks ago at a local store. Youth A
reported asking Staff 1 to buy her a vape once, but Staff 1 didn’t
do it. She said Staff 1 sleeps a lot during her shifts.
2

During her second interview, Youth A reported she “self-reflected”
after our first interview and reported she has smoked Staff 1’s
cigarettes and Staff 1 bought her, and Youth D vapes. She stated
she saw Staff 1 with alcohol during a walk to the store and saw
Staff 1 buy a small bottle of alcohol while she was at the store
then drink it on the way home. Youth A stated that, on 6/1/25,
Youth A went to the gas station with Staff 1 for snacks and drinks
and, while trying to get money out of the ATM, Staff 1 told Youth A
she was drunk. Youth A stated Staff 1 would buy vapes for Youth
A using Staff 1’s own money. She stated she asked for them a
couple times when they were in the store together. She stated
when they left the store, Staff 1 would hand the vapes to Youth A.
She stated Staff 1 would also hit the vapes. Youth A stated Staff 1
usually had cigarettes with her and when they were walking,
Youth A didn’t have a vape, so Staff 1 gave her an already lit
cigarette. There was also another time Staff 1 gave a lit cigarette
to Youth A. Youth A denied ever seeing Staff 1 buy drugs.
Youth B was interviewed by phone while MDHHS Worker was
with her in-person on 6/4/2025 and in-person at the independent
living home along with MDHHS Worker and Detective on
6/6/2025. Youth B reported there was night when Youth D was
having a problem with her boyfriend and was talking with Youth B
outside of the home, during which Youth D stated “I need a drink”
which Youth B took as joking around. Youth D went inside and
talked to Staff 1 after which Youth B, Youth D and Staff 1 walked
to the gas station around the corner. Youth B stated they all
walked into the gas station. Youth B grabbed what she needed
and walked out. She could see Youth D and Staff 1 through the
window and saw Staff 1 buy a package of gummies. She then
gave the gummies to Youth D in the parking lot. When they came
out, Youth D asked Youth B if she has ever had a weed gummy.
Youth B stated Staff 1 had a guy friend there and they walked off.
Youth B asked Staff 1 if she wanted them to walk her back to the
home, but she did not. Youth B asked Youth D for one of her
gummies which Youth D gave to her. Youth B stated she and
Youth D had planned to stay out and ride scooters, so that’s what
they did after eating the gummies. Youth B reported that she got
high from the gummy.
Youth B stated Staff 1 sent her $200 via cash app, but Staff 1 did
not tell her why. She stated she was talking to Staff 1 about
graduation so that could be why the money was sent.
Youth C was interviewed by phone while MDHHS Worker was
with her in-person on 6/4/2025 and in-person at the independent
3

living home along with MDHHS Worker and Detective on
6/6/2025. She stated she has lived at the independent living home
for approximately one month. She reported, sometime in May, she
walked to a local store with Staff 1 and saw Staff 1 buy “little”
bottles of alcohol which Staff 1 drank during their walk back to the
home. Youth C stated she doesn’t know what Staff 1 did with the
bottle but stated Staff 1 went to sleep when they got back to the
home. Youth C stated Staff 1 is usually on the phone or sleeping
while at work. Youth C reported Youth A told her Staff 1 drove to
work drunk the previous Sunday, 6/1/25. Youth C reported that
day was Staff 1’s birthday and Staff 1’s father has passed away
the day before. Youth C stated she walked to a local store with
Youth A and Staff 1 that day and saw Staff 1 buy a Blueberry
Lemonade flavored Breeze brand of vape and give it to Youth A.
She stated Staff 1 hit the vape, then gave it to Youth A who hit the
vape. Staff 1 then gave the vape to Youth A. Youth C reported she
has also seen Staff 1 buy a mint vape and give in to Youth A. She
stated Staff 1 bought vapes for Youth A 3-4 times. She stated she
has also seen Staff 1 vape in the staff office within the home.
Youth C stated Youth D told Youth C that Staff 1 bought a vape
for her once. Youth C stated she has also seen Youth A hit Staff
1’s cigarettes.
Youth D was interviewed by phone while MDHHS Worker was
with her in-person on 6/4/2025 and in-person at the independent
living home along with MDHHS Worker and Detective on
6/6/2025.She reported she has lived at the independent living
home for 11 months. She reported she has gone to the store with
Staff 1 who has purchased vapes for Youth D. She stated she
would give Staff 1 the money to buy the vapes for her. Most
recently, Staff 1 bought her a blue raspberry flavored vape. She
stated Staff 1 has also bought vapes for Youth A.
Youth D reported that, about a week ago, Staff 1 had a bottle of
Don Julio at work and offered some to Youth D. Youth D stated
she took a sip, and it burned her throat. Youth D stated the bottle
was only half full and Staff 1 “chugged” the rest of it. She also
reported that, about a month ago, she was in the home venting to
Staff 1 about all of the things that had happened that day and Staff
1 pulled out 2 Buzz Balls and asked Youth D if she wanted some.
Staff 1 opened the bottle, took a sip, then gave the bottle to Youth
D who took a sip. Youth D stated they passed the bottle back and
forth two more times. Youth D stated she did not see Staff 1 drink
the other buzz ball. Youth D reported there was a time Staff 1
came into work and said “girl, I am drunk as fuck.”
4

Youth D stated, a couple weeks ago, she said “damn, I kind of
want to get high right now” to Staff 1 after which she walked to a
nearby gas station with Staff 1 and Youth B. During her initial
interview, Youth D stated she asked Staff 1 to buy her weed
gummies and gave her the money to do so; however, during her
second interview she stated she did not ask Staff 1 to buy her
anything directly, but Staff 1 bought gummies for Youth D using
Youth D’s money. She stated Staff 1 bought a small package of
gummies with a mushroom and the word “float” on the package
and gave it to Youth D. Youth D stated she then ate one of the
gummies. She stated they were walking back toward the home
with Staff 1 behind them and Youth B asked Youth D for a
gummy, so she gave one to her.
Youth D stated Staff 1 showed her on her phone that she won
something like $87,000 after which Youth B showed Youth D her
Cash App documenting $200 was sent to her by Staff 1.
Youth E was interviewed by phone while MDHHS Worker was
with her in-person on 6/4/2025. She reported living at the home 1-
2 months. She reported the youths do not have access to drugs or
alcohol in the home. She stated a staff member recently asked her
if Staff 1 has ever given Youth E vapes or alcohol or if Youth E
has seen Staff 1 drunk, but Youth E denied any of these things
happening. Youth E stated she recently heard Youth A ask Staff 1
to buy her a vape but Youth E thought Staff 1 said no. Youth E
stated she has seen Staff 1 smoke cigarettes when they walk to
the store but has never seen her vape or buy any vapes for the
youths.
Staff 1 was interviewed in-person at her home along with MDHHS
Worker and Detective on 6/6/2025. Staff 1 stated the youths in the
home use their own money to buy stuff to drink and smoke and
she doesn’t understand what the difference is if she is with them
when they do it or if they are on their own. Staff 1 reported she
buys vapes for herself when at the store with the youths, but she
does not buy them for the youths. She stated they all smoke, but
she has never seen them buy anything to smoke. She denied ever
sharing her cigarettes with the youths. She stated about 1-2
weeks ago they went to the store and Youth D asked Staff 1 to
buy her a drink, but Staff 1 said no. Youth D gave Staff 1 a $50 bill
and Staff 1 bought a little package of “fake” gummies for Youth D.
Staff 1 stated her ID wasn’t checked when she bought them. She
stated Youth A is 18 and could have bought them herself and she
doesn’t know why Youth D asked Staff 1 to buy them. Staff 1
stated she “probably messed up” by buying the gummies but said
5

they would have gotten it anyway. She stated she did it because
Youth D is grown. Staff 1 stated Youth B was there too, and Staff
1 went back to the home while Youth B and Youth D went to do
something else.
Staff 1 stated she drinks Tito’s, Hennesey, and Buzz Balls but
denied drinking Don Julio. She stated she would never share a
Buzz Ball because those are “small, personal drinks” for herself.
She stated she has never seen any of the youths’ drink alcohol.
Staff 1 stated there were a few times she was called in to work so
she left a party and showed up to work intoxicated. Staff 1
reported that she thinks these allegations were made because
everyone is jealous that she won money in the lottery. She stated
she went in to work on her birthday and no one talked to her. Staff
1 reported she thinks Youth A is mad at her because she gave
$200 to Youth B but not to Youth A. Staff 1 stated she had been
planning to give Youth A money, too.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED
Samaritas New Employee Orientation Checklist: ILP Youth
Resident Support Worker signed by Staff 1 on 1/20/2025 which
indicates Staff 1 was informed of and agreed to the following:
• Professional work expectations.
• Appropriate boundaries.
• Role modeling for youth.
• Staff are prohibited from entering into any contractual or
financial relationship with the youth.
• Illegal drugs, cigarettes, alcohol are not allowed in the ILP
home, on the property, or on the person of any youth in the
program.
Samaritas Employee Handbook and Acknowledgment of
Handbook Receipt and Letter of Agreement signed by Staff 1 on
1/20/2025 which states:
• The unauthorized possession or use of any illegal drug or
alcohol or abuse of a legal drug poses an unacceptable risk
to the performance of our job responsibilities.
• The following activity will ordinarily result in immediate
discharge: While on Samaritas property or engaged in
Samaritas business, (1) being under the influence of
alcohol or a prohibited substance or having a detectable
level of alcohol or a prohibited substance in one’s system;
6

or (2) using, possessing, distributing, storing or selling
alcohol or a prohibited substance.
Email from Foster Care Worker to Staff 1 dated 5/16/2025 which
documented a recap of coaching that occurred the same day and
covered coaching on:
• Shift conduct- sleeping during shift is strictly prohibited.
• Documentation – Completing notes thoroughly and timely
and ensuring important information is documented.
• Timekeeping- Clocking in and out accurately according to
scheduled time.
Email from Foster Care Worker to Staff 1 dated 6/2/2025 which
documented a reminder to Staff 1 to complete her walk-through
charts as one had not been completed recently.
6/6/2025 internet search of gummy package described by Youth D
leading to WWW.FLOATMUSHROOMS.COM which indicates:
• Float Mushroom gummies contain 10mg of federally legal,
hemp derived Delta-9 THC per piece which includes .3%
THC
Michigan Regulation and Taxation of Marihuana Act documenting
the legal age to purchase Delta-9 products is 21.
Analysis A violation is established as Staff 1 did not demonstrate suitable
character or ability to provide for needs of the youth living in the
independent living home when she admitted to going into work
intoxicated and purchasing THC gummies for a youth under the
age of 21. While Staff 1 denied buying youths vapes, allowing
youths to smoke her cigarettes, or drinking while at work and
allowing youths to drink her alcohol, multiple youths in the home
provided consistent and detailed accounts of these things
occurring. Finally, Staff 1 did not follow agency policy by sleeping
during her shifts and not completing required tasks.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR 2015SIC0000237 dated 3/25/2025, CAP approved 4/22/2025
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A staff member at a Samaritas independent living home repeatedly violated policy by arriving to work intoxicated, purchasing alcohol, vapes, and THC gummies for youth residents, and sharing alcohol and cigarettes with them. The investigation substantiated allegations of the staff member providing substances to minors, drinking on duty, and sleeping during shifts. The staff member demonstrated a clear lack of responsible character and suitability for the role, directly endangering the youths in care.
